title: 114_hr394
content:
The Act is titled the "Prevention of Escapement of Genetically Altered Salmon in the United States Act" and prohibits the sale of genetically altered salmon. The Act prohibits the sale, transportation, possession, or release of covered fish or products containing covered fish in interstate commerce. It also prohibits engaging in net-pen aquaculture of covered fish and releasing covered fish into a natural environment, with an exception for scientific research purposes. The Act prohibits the sale, transportation, possession, or release of covered fish in interstate commerce, with exceptions for scientific research and enforcement purposes. The Under Secretary of Commerce can review applications to permit prohibited actions and make findings in accordance with the National Environmental Policy Act. The Under Secretary can review applications for prohibited actions involving covered fish and make findings consistent with an environmental impact statement. This statement includes an environmental risk analysis and a failure mode and effects analysis. Environmental Impact Considerations: Federal agencies must notify the Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere of any actions involving covered fish. The Under Secretary ensures compliance with regulations regarding covered fish. The Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere, in collaboration with relevant entities, may monitor proposed mitigation measures to ensure compliance. The provisions of this Act are additional and do not impact other laws regulating covered fish. The Secretary will establish necessary rules and regulations for implementation. SEC. 3. ENFORCEMENT AND PENALTIES.

The Secretary of Commerce can enforce section 2 using the same methods and powers as outlined in the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act. Violators of section 2 will face penalties as per the Magnuson-Stevens Act.

SEC. 4. REPORT ON RISKS TO WILD FISH STOCKS. The Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere must submit a report on risks to wild fish stocks to specific Senate and House committees within 180 days of this Act's enactment. Definitions are also provided in the Act. The Act defines "confined use" as operations in a secured facility preventing covered fish from impacting the environment. "Covered fish" refers to genetically modified finfish produced using DNA technologies. The Act defines "confined use" as operations in a secured facility to prevent genetically modified finfish from impacting the environment. Techniques used in traditional breeding and selection. The term "product" means an item manufactured or produced for sale or use as food.
